data.text:
Noah Sylvestre Name Noah Sylvestre Sex Male Born 6th April, 1990, Train Village, Sylvania, Lovia Spouse Brittany Sylvestre Children Garrett Sylvestre Parents Kevin Sylvestre

Zoey Sylvestre

Home Noble City Functions Basketball Player, and Politician Party affiliation Communist Languages French, English, and African Dialects Religious

stance Atheist

Noah Sylvestre (born 6 April 1990 in Train Village) is a Lovian basketball player living in Noble City. He has played on the Noble City team ever since he was a rookie. He is a member of the Communist Party of Lovia (neo-marxist). He is 6'6 210 pounds.

Biography []

He was born in Train Village to a French father and an African Mother. His father was a high school history teacher and the school's basketball coach. His mother was a nurse at the local hospital. In college, he was rated in the top 5 of active players. In the 2010 draft, he was selected 14th. In his first year in the league, he was named rookie of the year and 1st team all rookie. He is currently a 4 time All-Star, 4 time first team player, and 2014 MVP. This past year of the 2014-2015 season he won his first championship and was awarded M.V.P of the playoffs.

Stats[]

From his college and Pro times.

College

2008-2009: 16.5 points, 4.6 assists, 1.0 rebounds, 1.0 blocks, 0.4 steals

2009-2010: 18.5 points, 5.4 assists, 1.3 rebounds, 1.0 blocks, 0.5 steals

Pro[]

2010-2011: 18.5 points, 4.3 assists, 0.9 rebounds, 0.6 blocks, 0.4 steals

2011-2012: 22.5 points, 5.0 assists, 1.1 rebounds, 0.8 blocks, 0.6 steals

2012-2013: 26.5 points, 5.7 assists, 1.3 rebounds, 1.0 blocks, 0.5 steals

2013-2014: 30.5 points, 6.2 assists, 1.5 rebounds, 1.0 blocks, 0.5 steals

2014-2015: 26.5 points, 6.2 assists, 1.5 rebounds, 0.8 blocks, 0.4 steals

2015-2016: 24.5 points, 6.4 assists, 1.9 rebounds, 0.9 blocks, 0.4 steals

2016-2015: 22.5 points, 6.5 assists, 2.1 rebounds, 1.0 blocks, 0.6 steals

Honours[]

6x All-star: 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016,2017

6x first team all player: 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017

1x Rookie of the year: 2011

1x first team all rookie: 2011

1x M.V.P: 2014

1x scoring leader: 2014

2x foul shot % leader: 2013, 2014

2x minutes leader: 2013, 2014

1x champion: 2015

1x playoff M.V.P: 2015
